radiographic_examinations.findings: The gallbladder is distended with mild pericholecystic fluid and gallbladder wall thickening (up to 9 mm). A non-mobile 13 mm calculus is located at the gallbladder neck. No focal liver mass, no intrahepatic biliary dilation, and the hepatic parenchyma appears within normal limits.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: The non-mobile 13 mm calculus at the gallbladder neck remains as seen on a prior CT scan.
